This female voice was a backwards she said the first part going the one  
w=
ay, then she spoke the rest on the reverse side, she sounds a bit like me, =
 
however this is one of my sister's on the other side, it's either Debbie =
or  
Lori, not sure which one.  I think it's Debbie though.  In our family =
 the 
women have very similar voices.  My mother, grandmother, cousins,  si=
sters my 
daughter, and myself, all have similar voice, just a family trait=
.  sf 
 
 
In a message dated 7/25/2010 1:46:35 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,=
  
leongbabe@... writes:

 
 
 
Snowfire,
 
Thanks for making it louder=
 - I heard it this time and here  are my 
thoughts:  Sounds like a man's vo=
ice saying "we ain't dead", then  a woman's voice 
saying "that's a lie; ye=
ah we're dead".  Strangely the  woman's voice kind 
of sounded like your vo=
ice; it could be that whoever's  coming through is 
mimicking your voice (I=
've heard a similar mimicking effect  before in an EVP 
session conducted b=
y someone I know and trust).  The  other thought that 
crossed my mind is p=
erhaps you knowingly or unknowingly  spoke those words out 
loud and it was=
 picked up by your recorder's  microphone.  Please understand 
that I'm not=
 trying to be contrary and  that I'm just voicing my thoughts 
and could be=
 totally wrong since I do not  know you at all.
 
That being said, it's int=
eresting to me that after the  man said "we ain't 
dead," the woman replied=
 "that's a lie" (so  spirits, like humans, do lie); 
"yeah we're dead" (or =
perhaps the two  differ in their views on the state of 
being "dead").
 
No=
netheless this is all very interesting,  Snowfire; thank you for sharing.
 =

Sharon from SF





--part1_610c2.1cbe8a7.397dd41c_boundary
